availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph P. P'Pool (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer, schoolteacher, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer, schoolteacher, and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Son of Sarah F. P'Pool. Married to Dolly M. Wilson P'Pool. Father of Nicodemus "Nick" Gaither P'Pool, Sarah Alice P'Pool, Allen E. P'Pool, and Martha P'Pool. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer and schoolteacher in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Christian County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 359B.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 517B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465567, p. 114.
